titleStmt.title: Thērologia, The parly of beasts, or, Morphandra, queen of the inchanted iland wherein men were found, who being transmuted to beasts, though proffer'd to be dis-inchanted, and to becom men again, yet, in regard of the crying sins and rebellious humors of the times, they prefer the life of a brute animal before that of a rational creture ... : with reflexes upon the present state of most countries in Christendom : divided into a XI sections / by Jam. Howell, Esq.
titleStmt.author: Howell, James, 1594?-1666.

titleStmt.title: Thērologia, The parly of beasts, or, Morphandra, queen of the inchanted iland wherein men were found, who being transmuted to beasts, though proffer'd to be dis-inchanted, and to becom men again, yet, in regard of the crying sins and rebellious humors of the times, they prefer the life of a brute animal before that of a rational creture ... : with reflexes upon the present state of most countries in Christendom : divided into a XI sections / by Jam. Howell, Esq.
titleStmt.author: Howell, James, 1594?-1666.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W. Wilson for William Palmer ...,

notesStmt.note: Frontispiece engraved by Melan and Bosse, second plate engraved by R. Gaywood after F. Barlow.
First ed. Cf. Grolier. Wither to Prior.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
